questions.question: In addition to the environment, rock strength depends on the following : \ Statement (i) : Size of the rock specimen \ Statement (ii) : Rate of loading \ Statement (iii) : Cycle of loading \ Statement (iv) : Loading condition.
Mechanical properties which are of interest in rock mechanics are: Strength, Deformability, Elasticity and ___________

Mechanical properties of a rock mass depends on the following factors  Statement (i) : The mechanical properties of individual elements constituting the system.  Statement (ii) : The sliding friction along the planes of weakness.  Statement (iii) : The configuration of the system with respect to direction of loading  Statement (iv) :  The induced stress condition inside the mass.  Out of the above statements :

Statement (i) :  Rocks fail by splitting, shear or combination of these Statement (ii) : Failure of rock is either ductile or brittle and it depends upon the amount of temperature Statement (iii) : Fracture of rock is either ductile or brittle and it depends upon the amount of confining pressure Statement (iv) : Shear failure occurs in a rock if confining pressures are sufficiently high to prevent splitting. Out of above statements. which choice is correct.
